definition: clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
to treasure/to be very fond of
to have a special fondness (for sth)
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
bell tower/campanile/clock tower/Bell Tower, historic attraction in Xian, Beijing etc
Zhonglou district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu

sentences.english: Consequently, you will find that almost every one owns either a watch or a clock.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你会发现几乎每个人都拥有一只表或一个钟。

sentences.english: Well have some fun when the clock strikes one.
sentences.chinese: 我们要在钟敲一点时狂欢。

sentences.english: But there's a bus every ten minutes, and you are over 1 hour late.
sentences.chinese: 但是每十分钟就有一班公车，你迟到一个多钟了。

sentences.english: At a Chinese party the guests usually arrive 5-10 minutes early.
sentences.chinese: 中餐宴会客人凡是提前五至非常钟到达。

sentences.english: Put the clock on one hour when the time changes.
sentences.chinese: 更改时制后，把钟拨快一个小时。

sentences.english: How still the bells in steeples stand.
Safe boxes, fancy clock, mini fans, timers.
sentences.chinese: 保险盒，玩具钟，微型风扇，记时器。

sentences.english: Everything is sleeping now, expect the clock and me.
sentences.chinese: 现在，除了钟与我相伴，一切都在沉睡着。

sentences.english: What did it produce? The cuckoo clock.
Customs house's building and electronic waterfall clock also is quite new DuiJing.
sentences.chinese: 海关大楼与电子瀑布钟也是颇有新意的对景。

sentences.english: There's a clock and two pictures.

sentences.chinese: 十一点钟我到了布吉瓦尔。

sentences.english: A floor under the bells of an open belfry .
sentences.chinese: 在露天钟楼的钟下面的那一层板。

sentences.english: Hearing the question, he was silent for a minute or more.
sentences.chinese: 听到这个问题，他沉默了一分多钟。

sentences.english: Still, I'm glad the bell is working again.
sentences.chinese: 不过，钟又能报时了，我很高兴。

sentences.english: They had cleared the town, as the church-bell struck two.
sentences.chinese: 他们出城的时候，正赶上教堂的钟敲两点。

definition: surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale
